string.value: I gave #t4031432# to #b#p2091001##k of #b#m250000000##k. Hopefully now he'll lend me #t4031431#. I better go see #p2091001# right now.
#p2091001# met his end of the bargain and lent me #b#t4031431:##k. Now it's time for me to deliver it to #b#p2071010##k.

I gave #p2071010# the #t4031431#. Hopefully this will help #p2071010# become the Master at the intermediate level. Does that mean the intermediate-leveled Master can make not just the Gold Axe, but a Diamond-studded Axe?
0 = Oh, you must be the person that helped my old student out the other day. Thank you very much for giving me #t4031432#. I found #b#t4031431##k for my other student, so please take this.

So one of my students is being #b#p2071010##k at #b#m222000000##k... interesting. Should I visit him? Please let him know that he'll need to read #t4031431# and reach the medium level of the course to become the Legendary Being.
Hmph? You didn't take the item that you are supposed to deliver. Is there anything going on?

Ohh... this is #t4031431#! You must have visited #m250000000#. And you even gave the master my best wishes. Great job, my friend... great job. Here's a Gold Axe for your stellar... hmmm. Regrettably, I do not think I can reward you with a Gold Axe. The price of gold has been skyrocketing these days, and... hmph. I apologize.

Hmmm... the introductory level was difficult, so how hard would the medium level be... let's see ... oh, this looks difficult, as expected. What? The master is coming? When will I be able to master all this??
Hmm? Why are you just standing around here? I have lent you #b#t4031431##k, so please take it and go see #b#p2071010##k.
You're not at #m250000000#, yet? #p2091001# of #m250000000# is indeed, my master. Please lend this copy of #t4031431# to him.
Ahh, you're here now. The Legendary Being's Scroll may be lost, but everyone visits the Legendary Being. Here's the #b#t4031431##k, so please take this to the #bMountain God#k.
